name: Cyber Fitness Seed Content Pack v1
description: Curated scenarios for essential cybersecurity practices

domains.title: Password Security
domains.description: Master strong password practices and multi-factor authentication

questions.text: Do you use a password manager to generate and store unique passwords?
questions.explanation: Password managers create strong, unique passwords for each account and remember them for you.
questions.actionHint: Try Bitwarden, 1Password, or your browser's built-in manager

answers.text: Yes, I use a password manager

questions.text: Do you have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled on your banking accounts?
questions.explanation: MFA adds an extra security layer, making it much harder for attackers to access your financial accounts.
questions.actionHint: Check your bank's security settings - usually found in Account Settings

domains.title: Safe Browsing
domains.description: Browse the web securely and avoid common online threats

questions.text: Do you check for HTTPS (the lock icon) when entering sensitive information?
questions.explanation: HTTPS encrypts data between your browser and websites, protecting against eavesdropping.
questions.actionHint: Look for the lock icon in your address bar before entering passwords or personal info

answers.text: Yes, I always check for HTTPS

questions.text: Do you use an ad blocker to reduce malicious ads and tracking?
questions.explanation: Ad blockers prevent malicious ads and reduce tracking, improving both security and privacy.
questions.actionHint: Install uBlock Origin or similar extension in your browser

answers.text: Yes, I use an ad blocker

domains.title: Device Security
domains.description: Lock down your devices with proper security settings

questions.text: Does your phone/computer automatically lock after a few minutes of inactivity?
questions.explanation: Auto-lock prevents unauthorized access if you step away from your device.
questions.actionHint: Set screen lock to 5 minutes or less in your device settings

questions.text: Is full-disk encryption enabled on your devices?
questions.explanation: Encryption protects your data if your device is lost or stolen.
questions.actionHint: Enable BitLocker (Windows), FileVault (Mac), or device encryption (mobile)

domains.title: Network Protection
domains.description: Secure your home network and practice safe WiFi habits

questions.text: Is your home WiFi network secured with WPA3 or WPA2 encryption?
questions.explanation: Encrypted WiFi prevents neighbors and nearby attackers from accessing your network traffic.
questions.actionHint: Check router settings - avoid WEP or open networks

domains.title: Data Protection
domains.description: Keep your important data safe with backups and smart sharing practices

questions.text: Do you regularly backup your important files and photos?
questions.explanation: Backups protect against data loss from hardware failure, ransomware, or accidental deletion.
questions.actionHint: Set up automatic cloud backup or external drive backup

questions.text: Are you cautious about opening email attachments from unknown senders?
questions.explanation: Email attachments are a common way malware spreads. Be especially careful with .exe, .zip, and office files.
questions.actionHint: When in doubt, don't open it. Verify with the sender through a different communication method
